title: Proof, not promises: New food products to get strict checks; FSSAI makes evidence mandatory
description: India's food regulator, FSSAI, will now mandate scientific evidence for all food safety reviews and standard changes from January 1, 2026. Submissions must detail nutritional information, consumption patterns, toxicological studies, and allergy risks specific to Indian consumers. This move aims to ensure practical, science-based, and safer food regulations for the public.

description: Filmmaker Sriram Raghavan expressed his admiration for the box office hit 'Dhurandhar' by Aditya Dhar, but firmly stated that he would never venture into a similar filmmaking territory. He appreciates the film's success and compelling performances; however, he feels that its style does not resonate with his artistic vision or the evolving landscape of thriller cinema.

Drill, dash, disappear: Robbers crack German bank vault; vanish with $35 million
description: Robbers drilled into a bank vault in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, making off with approximately $35 million in cash, gold, and jewelry. The suspects successfully breached over 3,000 safe deposit boxes before escaping. Authorities are currently investigating the incident, and the perpetrators remain at large.

A place where your faith was acceptable as all the other faiths that existed in the American tapestry.

Retirement that stunned Indian cricket - How Dhoni's Test career ended
description: Without any ceremony, 44 minutes after MS Dhoni finished his post-match press conference following the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the BCCI sent out a press release. The news came an hour after India had managed to draw an away Test — the first time in the previous 14 Australia-India Tests that the visiting team had not lost.

Despite hazardous conditions and the risk of accidents, drivers continue their duty due to contractual pay. The UPSRTC is taking measures like fog lights and speed limits, but inadequate expressway lighting exacerbates the dangers.

2025: Google made up for its '2024 AI mistake'; error made CEO Pichai say 'unacceptable'
description: Google's AI comeback, spearheaded by Gemini 3, has shaken OpenAI, forcing CEO Sam Altman to issue a 'code red'.  Following earlier stumbles, a dream team including Demis Hassabis and Sergey Brin revitalized the company.  Gemini's user base surged, surpassing ChatGPT in app store rankings and challenging OpenAI's enterprise dominance, marking a significant shift in the AI landscape.

Defining moment: India now 4th largest economy; when will it overtake Germany?
description: India has emerged as the world’s fourth-largest economy, overtaking Japan, and is projected to challenge Germany for the third spot within the next three years. The government remains confident about sustaining growth momentum despite global trade uncertainties.

title: Ban on Starlink: China says Musk's SpaceX national security threat; What China fears
description: Chinese authorities have penalized a foreign vessel for illegally using Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite internet service, within its waters. Banned in China due to national security concerns and lack of operating licenses, Starlink's overseas gateway routing is seen as a threat to strategic interests. China aims to counter this perceived monopoly by developing its own reusable rocket technology.

title: Gruesome murder: Robbers kill wife of Punjab's former top govt lawyer; help detained
description: A shocking incident in Mohali saw Ashok Kumari Goyal, wife of a former Additional Advocate General, found strangled in her home. The family's servant was discovered tied up, with police suspecting a robbery gone awry. Valuables and cash are reported missing, and the accused are still at large. The servant's account has raised suspicions, leading to his detention for questioning.

title: Stephen Curry’s son Canon Curry stuns fans with elite dribbling skills
description: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: Candace Owens flags new claims questioning Charlie Kirk death timeline
description: Candace Owens says Mitch Snow’s claims about Charlie Kirk’s death need verified timelines, not assumptions. Snow, a retired Army medic, says he was at Fort Huachuca and saw key figures. Online users question his memory and details. No official proof confirms his account. Owens asks for solid evidence to settle the debate.

title: Stefon Diggs scans stands for Cardi B after Patriots’ 42-10 win over Jets
description: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk’s public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
description: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk’s public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: Chinese billionaire’s plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 kids; wants US-borns to run video game biz
description: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.
